question: When is the International Day for Eradication of Poverty observed?
explanation:
Every year, the International Day for Eradication of Poverty is observed by the United Nations on October 17. The theme for this year’s International Day for Eradication of Poverty is “Acting together to achieve social and environmental justice for all”.
The resolution to observe this day was adopted in the United Nations General Assembly in 1992. This year marks the 27th anniversary of the UN Resolution.
